FieldOscalAssessmentCommonObservationTyp.description: Identifies the nature of the observation. More than one may be used to further qualify and enable filtering.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonResponseDescri.title: Response Description
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonResponseDescri.description: A human-readable description of this response plan.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonResponseRequir.title: Description of Required Asset
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonResponseRequir.description: A human-readable description of this required asset.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonResponseRequir.title: Title for Required Asset
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonResponseRequir.description: The title for this required asset.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonResponseTitleT.title: Response Title
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonResponseTitleT.description: The title for this response activity.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskDeadlineTy.title: Risk Resolution Deadline
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskDeadlineTy.description: The date/time by which the risk must be resolved.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskDescriptio.title: Risk Description
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskDescriptio.description: A human-readable summary of the identified risk, to include a statement of how the risk impacts the system.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskMitigating.title: Mitigating Factor Description
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskMitigating.description: A human-readable description of this mitigating factor.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRiskLogEnt.title: Risk Task Description
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRiskLogEnt.description: A human-readable description of what was done regarding the risk.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRiskLogEnt.title: End
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRiskLogEnt.description: Identifies the end date and time of the event. If the event is a point in time, the start and end will be the same date and time.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRiskLogEnt.title: Start
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRiskLogEnt.description: Identifies the start date and time of the event.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRiskLogEnt.title: Title
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRiskLogEnt.description: The title for this risk log entry.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskStatementT.title: Risk Statement
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskStatementT.description: An summary of impact for how the risk affects the system.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskStatusType.title: Risk Status
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonRiskStatusType.description: Describes the status of the associated risk.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonSubjectReferen.title: Subject Reference Title
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonSubjectReferen.description: The title or name for the referenced subject.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonTaskDescriptio.title: Task Description
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonTaskDescriptio.description: A human-readable description of this task.

FieldOscalAssessmentCommonThreatIdType.title: Threat ID
FieldOscalAssessmentCommonThreatIdType.description: A pointer, by ID, to an externally-defined threat.

href.title: Threat Information Resource Reference
href.description:
An optional location for the threat data, from which this ID originates.

This value may be one of:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
3. a bare URI fragment (i.e., \`#uuid\`) pointing to a `back-matter` resource in this or an imported document (see [linking to another OSCAL object](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#linking-to-another-oscal-object)).

system.title: Threat Type Identification System
system.description:
Specifies the source of the threat information.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

FieldOscalImplementationCommonInventoryI.title: Inventory Item Description
FieldOscalImplementationCommonInventoryI.description: A summary of the inventory item stating its purpose within the system.

FieldOscalImplementationCommonProtocolTi.title: Protocol Title
FieldOscalImplementationCommonProtocolTi.description: A human readable name for the protocol (e.g., Transport Layer Security).

FieldOscalImplementationCommonSystemComp.title: Component Description
FieldOscalImplementationCommonSystemComp.description: A description of the component, including information about its function.

FieldOscalImplementationCommonSystemComp.title: Purpose
FieldOscalImplementationCommonSystemComp.description: A summary of the technological or business purpose of the component.

FieldOscalImplementationCommonSystemComp.title: Component Title
FieldOscalImplementationCommonSystemComp.description: A human readable name for the system component.

FieldOscalImplementationCommonSystemIdTy.title: System Identification
FieldOscalImplementationCommonSystemIdTy.description: A [human-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#human-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this system identification property elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). When referencing an externally defined `system identification`, the `system identification` must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference). This string should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same system across revisions of the document.

identifier-type.title: Identification System Type
identifier-type.description:
Identifies the identification system from which the provided identifier was assigned.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

FieldOscalMetadataAddrLineType.title: Address line
FieldOscalMetadataAddrLineType.description: A single line of an address.

FieldOscalMetadataAddressCityType.title: City
FieldOscalMetadataAddressCityType.description: City, town or geographical region for the mailing address.

FieldOscalMetadataAddressCountryType.title: Country Code
FieldOscalMetadataAddressCountryType.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the mailing address.

FieldOscalMetadataAddressPostalCodeType.title: Postal Code
FieldOscalMetadataAddressPostalCodeType.description: Postal or ZIP code for mailing address.

FieldOscalMetadataAddressStateType.title: State
FieldOscalMetadataAddressStateType.description: State, province or analogous geographical region for a mailing address.

FieldOscalMetadataBackMatterResourceBase.title: Base64
FieldOscalMetadataBackMatterResourceBase.description: A resource encoded using the Base64 alphabet defined by [RFC 2045](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc2045.html).

filename.title: File Name
filename.description: Name of the file before it was encoded as Base64 to be embedded in a `resource`. This is the name that will be assigned to the file when the file is decoded.

media-type.title: Media Type
media-type.description: A label that indicates the nature of a resource, as a data serialization or format.

FieldOscalMetadataBackMatterResourceDesc.title: Resource Description
FieldOscalMetadataBackMatterResourceDesc.description: An optional short summary of the resource used to indicate the purpose of the resource.

FieldOscalMetadataBackMatterResourceTitl.title: Resource Title
FieldOscalMetadataBackMatterResourceTitl.description: An optional name given to the resource, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

FieldOscalMetadataDocumentIdType.title: Document Identifier
FieldOscalMetadataDocumentIdType.description:
A document identifier qualified by an identifier `scheme`.

A document identifier provides a [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with a [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that is used for a group of documents that are to be treated as different versions, representations or digital surrogates of the same document.

A document identifier provides an additional data point for identifying a document that can be assigned by a publisher or organization for purposes in a wider system, such as a digital object identifier (DOI) or a local content management system identifier.

Use of a document identifier allows for document creators to associate sets of documents that are related in some way by the same `document-id`.

An OSCAL document always has an implicit document identifier provided by the document's UUID, defined by the `uuid` on the top-level object. Having a default UUID-based identifier ensures all documents can be minimally identified when other document identifiers are not provided.

scheme.title: Document Identification Scheme
scheme.description:
Qualifies the kind of document identifier using a URI. If the scheme is not provided the value of the element will be interpreted as a string of characters.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

FieldOscalMetadataEmailAddressType.title: Email Address
FieldOscalMetadataEmailAddressType.description: An email address as defined by [RFC 5322 Section 3.4.1](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5322#section-3.4.1).

FieldOscalMetadataHashType.title: Hash
FieldOscalMetadataHashType.description: A representation of a cryptographic digest generated over a resource using a specified hash algorithm.

algorithm.title: Hash algorithm
algorithm.description:
The digest method by which a hash is derived.

Any other value used MUST be a value defined in the W3C [XML Security Algorithm Cross-Reference](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlsec-algorithms/#digest-method-uris) Digest Methods (W3C, April 2013) or [RFC 6931 Section 2.1.5](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6931#section-2.1.5) New SHA Functions.

FieldOscalMetadataLastModifiedType.title: Last Modified Timestamp
FieldOscalMetadataLastModifiedType.description:
The date and time the document was last stored for later retrieval.

This value represents the point in time when the OSCAL document was last updated, or at the point of creation the creation date. Typically, this date value will be machine generated at time of creation or modification. Ideally, this field will be managed by the editing tool or service used to make modifications when storing the modified document.

The intent of the last modified timestamp is to distinguish between significant change milestones when the document may be accessed by multiple entities. This allows a given entity to differentiate between mutiple document states at specific points in time. It is possible to make multiple modifications to the document without storing these changes. In such a case, the last modified timestamp might not be updated until the document is finally stored.

In some cases, an OSCAL document may be derived from some source material in a different format. In such a case, the `last-modified` value should indicate the last modification time of the OSCAL document instance, not the source material.

FieldOscalMetadataLinkTextType.title: Link Text
FieldOscalMetadataLinkTextType.description: A textual label to associate with the link, which may be used for presentation in a tool.

FieldOscalMetadataLocationUuidType.title: Location Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FieldOscalMetadataLocationUuidType.description: Reference to a location by UUID.

FieldOscalMetadataMetadataLocationTitleT.title: Location Title
FieldOscalMetadataMetadataLocationTitleT.description: A name given to the location, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

FieldOscalMetadataMetadataLocationUrlTyp.title: Location URL
FieldOscalMetadataMetadataLocationUrlTyp.description:
The uniform resource locator (URL) for a web site or other resource associated with the location.

This data field is deprecated in favor of using a link with an appropriate relationship.

FieldOscalMetadataMetadataPartyExternalI.title: Party External Identifier
FieldOscalMetadataMetadataPartyExternalI.description: An identifier for a person or organization using a designated scheme. e.g. an Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID).

scheme.title: External Identifier Schema
scheme.description:
Indicates the type of external identifier.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

FieldOscalMetadataMetadataPartyMemberOfO.title: Organizational Affiliation
FieldOscalMetadataMetadataPartyMemberOfO.description:
A reference to another `party` by UUID, typically an organization, that this subject is associated with.

Since the reference target of an organizational affiliation must be another `party` (whether further qualified as person or organization) as inidcated by its `uuid`. As a [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier with uniqueness across document and trans-document scope, this `uuid` value is sufficient to reference the data item locally or globally across related documents, e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance.

Parties of both the `person` or `organization` type can be associated with an organization using the `member-of-organization`.

FieldOscalMetadataMetadataPartyNameType.title: Party Name
FieldOscalMetadataMetadataPartyNameType.description: The full name of the party. This is typically the legal name associated with the party.

FieldOscalMetadataMetadataPartyShortName.title: Party Short Name
FieldOscalMetadataMetadataPartyShortName.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the party.

FieldOscalMetadataMetadataRevisionTitleT.title: Document Title
FieldOscalMetadataMetadataRevisionTitleT.description: A name given to the document revision, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

FieldOscalMetadataMetadataRoleDescriptio.title: Role Description
FieldOscalMetadataMetadataRoleDescriptio.description: A summary of the role's purpose and associated responsibilities.

FieldOscalMetadataMetadataRoleShortNameT.title: Role Short Name
FieldOscalMetadataMetadataRoleShortNameT.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the role.

FieldOscalMetadataMetadataRoleTitleType.title: Role Title
FieldOscalMetadataMetadataRoleTitleType.description: A name given to the role, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

FieldOscalMetadataMetadataTitleType.title: Document Title
FieldOscalMetadataMetadataTitleType.description: A name given to the document, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

FieldOscalMetadataOscalVersionType.title: OSCAL Version
FieldOscalMetadataOscalVersionType.description:
The OSCAL model version the document was authored against and will conform to as valid.

Indicates the version of the OSCAL model to which the document conforms, for example "1.1.0" or "1.0.0-milestone1". That can be used as a hint for a tool indicating which version of the OSCAL XML or JSON schema to use for validation.

The OSCAL version serves a different purpose from the document version and is used to represent a different concept. If both have the same value, this is coincidental.

FieldOscalMetadataPartyUuidType.title: Party Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FieldOscalMetadataPartyUuidType.description: Reference to a party by UUID.

FieldOscalMetadataPublishedType.title: Publication Timestamp
FieldOscalMetadataPublishedType.description:
The date and time the document was last made available.

Typically, this date value will be machine-generated at the time the containing document is published.

In some cases, an OSCAL document may be derived from some source material provided in a different format. In such a case, the `published` value should indicate when the OSCAL document instance was last published, not the source material.

FieldOscalMetadataRemarksType.title: Remarks
FieldOscalMetadataRemarksType.description:
Additional commentary about the containing object.

The `remarks` field SHOULD not be used to store arbitrary data. Instead, a `prop` or `link` should be used to annotate or reference any additional data not formally supported by OSCAL.

FieldOscalMetadataTelephoneNumberType.title: Telephone Number
FieldOscalMetadataTelephoneNumberType.description: A telephone service number as defined by [ITU-T E.164](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164-201011-I/en).

type.title: type flag
type.description: Indicates the type of phone number.

FieldOscalMetadataVersionType.title: Document Version
FieldOscalMetadataVersionType.description:
Used to distinguish a specific revision of an OSCAL document from other previous and future versions.

A version may be a release number, sequence number, date, or other identifier sufficient to distinguish between different document revisions.

While not required, it is recommended that OSCAL content authors use [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html) as the version format. This allows for the easy identification of a version tree consisting of major, minor, and patch numbers.

A version is typically set by the document owner or by the tool used to maintain the content.

FieldOscalPoamPoamItemDescriptionType.title: POA&M Item Description
FieldOscalPoamPoamItemDescriptionType.description: A human-readable description of POA\&M item.

FieldOscalPoamPoamItemTitleType.title: POA&M Item Title
FieldOscalPoamPoamItemTitleType.description: The title or name for this POA\&M item .

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonAssessmentAsset.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonAssessmentAsset.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a component that is implemented as part of an inventory item.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonAssessmentAsset.title: Assessment Platform Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonAssessmentAsset.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this assessment platform elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined *UUID* of the `assessment platform` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an [imported OSCAL instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope)). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonAssessmentSubje.title: Subject Type
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonAssessmentSubje.description: Indicates the type of assessment subject, such as a component, inventory, item, location, or party represented by this selection statement.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonCharacterizatio.title: Facet Name
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonCharacterizatio.description: The name of the risk metric within the specified system.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonCharacterizatio.title: Naming System
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonCharacterizatio.description:
Specifies the naming system under which this risk metric is organized, which allows for the same names to be used in different systems controlled by different parties. This avoids the potential of a name clash.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonCharacterizatio.title: Facet Value
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonCharacterizatio.description: Indicates the value of the facet.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingAssociat.title: Risk Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingAssociat.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a risk defined in the list of risks.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingRelatedO.title: Observation Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingRelatedO.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to an observation defined in the list of observations.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingTargetSt.title: Objective Status Reason
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingTargetSt.description:
The reason the objective was given it's status.

Reason may contain any value, and should be used to communicate additional information regarding the status.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingTargetSt.title: Objective Status State
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingTargetSt.description: An indication as to whether the objective is satisfied or not.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingTargetTa.title: Finding Target Identifier Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingTargetTa.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference for a specific target qualified by the `type`.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingTargetTy.title: Finding Target Type
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingTargetTy.description:
Identifies the type of the target.

The target will always be a reference to: 1) a control statement, or 2) a control objective. In the former case, there is always a single top-level statement within a control. Thus, if the entire control is targeted, this statement identifier can be used.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingUuidType.title: Finding Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonFindingUuidType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this finding in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ar-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `finding` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonImportSspHrefTy.title: System Security Plan Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonImportSspHrefTy.description:
A resolvable URL reference to the system security plan for the system being assessed.

This value may be one of:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
3. a bare URI fragment (i.e., \`#uuid\`) pointing to a `back-matter` resource in this or an imported document (see [linking to another OSCAL object](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#linking-to-another-oscal-object)).

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonLoggedByPartyUu.title: Party UUID Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonLoggedByPartyUu.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to the party who is making the log entry.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonLoggedByRoleIdT.title: Actor Role
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonLoggedByRoleIdT.description: A point to the role-id of the role in which the party is making the log entry.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonObservationRele.title: Relevant Evidence Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonObservationRele.description:
A resolvable URL reference to relevant evidence.

This value may be one of:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
3. a bare URI fragment (i.e., \`#uuid\`) pointing to a `back-matter` resource in this or an imported document (see [linking to another OSCAL object](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#linking-to-another-oscal-object)).

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonObservationUuid.title: Observation Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonObservationUuid.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with *cross-instance* scope that can be used to reference this observation elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `observation` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imorted OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonOriginActorActo.title: Actor Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonOriginActorActo.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to the tool or person based on the associated type.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonOriginActorRole.title: Actor Role
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonOriginActorRole.description: For a party, this can optionally be used to specify the role the actor was performing.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRelatedTaskIden.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRelatedTaskIden.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a unique assessment subject placeholder defined by this task.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRelatedTaskTask.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRelatedTaskTask.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a unique task.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonResponseLifecyc.title: Remediation Intent
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonResponseLifecyc.description: Identifies whether this is a recommendation, such as from an assessor or tool, or an actual plan accepted by the system owner.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonResponseRequire.title: Required Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonResponseRequire.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this required asset elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `asset` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonResponseUuidTyp.title: Remediation Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonResponseUuidTyp.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this remediation elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `risk response` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRiskMitigatingF.title: Implementation UUID
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRiskMitigatingF.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this implementation statement elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope)s. The locally defined *UUID* of the `implementation statement` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRiskMitigatingF.title: Mitigating Factor Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRiskMitigatingF.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this mitigating factor elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `mitigating factor` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRelatedObse.title: Observation Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRelatedObse.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to an observation defined in the list of observations.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRiskLogEntr.title: Response Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRiskLogEntr.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a unique risk response.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRiskLogEntr.title: Risk Log Entry Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRiskRiskLogEntr.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this risk log entry elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `risk log entry` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRiskUuidType.title: Risk Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonRiskUuidType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this risk elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `risk` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonSubjectTypeType.title: Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference Type
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonSubjectTypeType.description: Used to indicate the type of object pointed to by the `uuid-ref` within a subject.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonSubjectUuidType.title: Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonSubjectUuidType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a component, inventory-item, location, party, user, or resource using it's UUID.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskAssociatedA.title: Activity Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskAssociatedA.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to an activity defined in the list of activities.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskDependencyT.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskDependencyT.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a unique task.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskTimingAtFre.title: Period
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskTimingAtFre.description: The task must occur after the specified period has elapsed.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskTimingAtFre.title: Time Unit
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskTimingAtFre.description: The unit of time for the period.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskTimingOnDat.title: On Date Condition
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskTimingOnDat.description: The task must occur on the specified date.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskTimingWithi.title: End Date Condition
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskTimingWithi.description: The task must occur on or before the specified date.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskTimingWithi.title: Start Date Condition
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskTimingWithi.description: The task must occur on or after the specified date.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskUuidType.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonTaskUuidType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this task elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `task` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonThreatIdHrefTyp.title: Threat Information Resource Reference
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonThreatIdHrefTyp.description:
An optional location for the threat data, from which this ID originates.

This value may be one of:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
3. a bare URI fragment (i.e., \`#uuid\`) pointing to a `back-matter` resource in this or an imported document (see [linking to another OSCAL object](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#linking-to-another-oscal-object)).

FlagOscalAssessmentCommonThreatIdSystemT.title: Threat Type Identification System
FlagOscalAssessmentCommonThreatIdSystemT.description:
Specifies the source of the threat information.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

FlagOscalImplementationCommonImplementat.title: Implementation State
FlagOscalImplementationCommonImplementat.description: Identifies the implementation status of the control or control objective.

FlagOscalImplementationCommonInventoryIt.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalImplementationCommonInventoryIt.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a `component` that is implemented as part of an inventory item.

FlagOscalImplementationCommonInventoryIt.title: Inventory Item Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalImplementationCommonInventoryIt.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this inventory item elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `inventory item` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalImplementationCommonPortRangeEn.title: End
FlagOscalImplementationCommonPortRangeEn.description:
Indicates the ending port number in a port range for a transport layer protocol

Should be a number within a permitted range

FlagOscalImplementationCommonPortRangeSt.title: Start
FlagOscalImplementationCommonPortRangeSt.description:
Indicates the starting port number in a port range for a transport layer protocol

Should be a number within a permitted range

FlagOscalImplementationCommonProtocolNam.title: Protocol Name
FlagOscalImplementationCommonProtocolNam.description:
The common name of the protocol, which should be the appropriate "service name" from the [IANA Service Name and Transport Protocol Port Number Registry](https://www.iana.org/assignments/service-names-port-numbers/service-names-port-numbers.xhtml).

The short name of the protocol (e.g., https).

FlagOscalImplementationCommonProtocolUui.title: Service Protocol Information Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalImplementationCommonProtocolUui.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this service protocol information elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `service protocol` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalImplementationCommonSystemCompo.title: Component Type
FlagOscalImplementationCommonSystemCompo.description: A category describing the purpose of the component.

FlagOscalImplementationCommonSystemCompo.title: Component Identifier
FlagOscalImplementationCommonSystemCompo.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this component elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). The locally defined *UUID* of the `component` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalImplementationCommonSystemIdIde.title: Identification System Type
FlagOscalImplementationCommonSystemIdIde.description:
Identifies the identification system from which the provided identifier was assigned.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

FlagOscalMetadataActionDateType.title: Action Occurrence Date
FlagOscalMetadataActionDateType.description: The date and time when the action occurred.

FlagOscalMetadataActionSystemType.title: Action Type System
FlagOscalMetadataActionSystemType.description:
Specifies the action type system used.

Provides a means to segment the value space for the `type`, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed `action`'s `type`. This allows the semantics associated with a given `type` to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.

An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.

FlagOscalMetadataActionTypeType.title: Action Type
FlagOscalMetadataActionTypeType.description: The type of action documented by the assembly, such as an approval.

FlagOscalMetadataActionUuidType.title: Action Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalMetadataActionUuidType.description: A unique identifier that can be used to reference this defined action elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalMetadataBackMatterResourceBase6.title: File Name
FlagOscalMetadataBackMatterResourceBase6.description: Name of the file before it was encoded as Base64 to be embedded in a `resource`. This is the name that will be assigned to the file when the file is decoded.

FlagOscalMetadataBackMatterResourceRlink.title: Hypertext Reference
FlagOscalMetadataBackMatterResourceRlink.description:
A resolvable URL pointing to the referenced resource.

This value may be either:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or

FlagOscalMetadataBackMatterResourceUuidT.title: Resource Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalMetadataBackMatterResourceUuidT.description: A unique identifier for a resource.

FlagOscalMetadataDocumentIdSchemeType.title: Document Identification Scheme
FlagOscalMetadataDocumentIdSchemeType.description:
Qualifies the kind of document identifier using a URI. If the scheme is not provided the value of the element will be interpreted as a string of characters.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

FlagOscalMetadataHashAlgorithmType.title: Hash algorithm
FlagOscalMetadataHashAlgorithmType.description:
The digest method by which a hash is derived.

Any other value used MUST be a value defined in the W3C [XML Security Algorithm Cross-Reference](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlsec-algorithms/#digest-method-uris) Digest Methods (W3C, April 2013) or [RFC 6931 Section 2.1.5](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6931#section-2.1.5) New SHA Functions.

FlagOscalMetadataLinkHrefType.title: Hypertext Reference
FlagOscalMetadataLinkHrefType.description:
A resolvable URL reference to a resource.

This value may be one of:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
3. a bare URI fragment (i.e., \`#uuid\`) pointing to an OSCAL object by the objects identifier (e.g., id, uuid) in this or an imported document (see [linking to another OSCAL object](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#linking-to-another-oscal-object)). The specific object type will differ based on the link relationship type.

FlagOscalMetadataLinkRelType.title: Link Relation Type
FlagOscalMetadataLinkRelType.description: Describes the type of relationship provided by the link's hypertext reference. This can be an indicator of the link's purpose.

FlagOscalMetadataLinkResourceFragmentTyp.title: Resource Fragment
FlagOscalMetadataLinkResourceFragmentTyp.description: In case where the `href` points to a `back-matter/resource`, this value will indicate the URI [fragment](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3986#section-3.5) to append to any `rlink` associated with the resource. This value MUST be [URI encoded](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3986#section-2.1).

FlagOscalMetadataMediaTypeType.title: Media Type
FlagOscalMetadataMediaTypeType.description:
A label that indicates the nature of a resource, as a data serialization or format.

The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) [Media Types Registry](https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml) defines a standardized set of media types, which may be used here.

The `application/oscal+xml`, `application/oscal+json` or `application/oscal+yaml` media types SHOULD be used when referencing OSCAL XML, JSON, or YAML resources respectively.

\*\*Note: There is no official media type for YAML at this time.\*\* OSCAL documents should specify `application/yaml` for general YAML content, or `application/oscal+yaml` for YAML-based OSCAL content. This approach aligns with use of a structured name suffix, per [RFC 6838 Section 4.2.8](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6838.html#section-4.2.8).

Some earlier OSCAL content incorporated the model into the media type. For example: `application/oscal.catalog+xml`. This practice SHOULD be avoided, since the OSCAL model can be detected by parsing the initial content of the referenced resource.

FlagOscalMetadataMetadataLocationUuidTyp.title: Location Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalMetadataMetadataLocationUuidTyp.description: A unique ID for the location, for reference.

FlagOscalMetadataMetadataPartyExternalId.title: External Identifier Schema
FlagOscalMetadataMetadataPartyExternalId.description:
Indicates the type of external identifier.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

FlagOscalMetadataMetadataPartyTypeType.title: Party Type
FlagOscalMetadataMetadataPartyTypeType.description: A category describing the kind of party the object describes.

FlagOscalMetadataMetadataPartyUuidType.title: Party Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalMetadataMetadataPartyUuidType.description: A unique identifier for the party.

FlagOscalMetadataMetadataRoleIdType.title: Role Identifier
FlagOscalMetadataMetadataRoleIdType.description: A unique identifier for the role.

FlagOscalMetadataPropertyClassType.title: Property Class
FlagOscalMetadataPropertyClassType.description:
A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's `name`.

This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple properties of the same object with the same `name` and `ns`, or to group properties into categories.

A `class` can be used in validation rules to express extra constraints over named items of a specific `class` value. It is available for grouping, but unlike `group` is not expected specifically to designate any group membership as such.

FlagOscalMetadataPropertyGroupType.title: Property Group
FlagOscalMetadataPropertyGroupType.description:
An identifier for relating distinct sets of properties.

Different sets of properties may relate to separate contexts. Declare a group on a property to associate it with one or more other properties in a given context.

FlagOscalMetadataPropertyNameType.title: Property Name
FlagOscalMetadataPropertyNameType.description: A textual label, within a namespace, that identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or quality of the property's containing object.

FlagOscalMetadataPropertyNsType.title: Property Namespace
FlagOscalMetadataPropertyNsType.description:
A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

When a `ns` is not provided, its value should be assumed to be `http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal` and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.

FlagOscalMetadataPropertyUuidType.title: Property Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalMetadataPropertyUuidType.description: A unique identifier for a property.

FlagOscalMetadataPropertyValueType.title: Property Value
FlagOscalMetadataPropertyValueType.description: Indicates the value of the attribute, characteristic, or quality.

FlagOscalMetadataResponsiblePartyRoleIdT.title: Responsible Role
FlagOscalMetadataResponsiblePartyRoleIdT.description: A reference to a `role` performed by a `party`.

FlagOscalMetadataResponsibleRoleRoleIdTy.title: Responsible Role ID
FlagOscalMetadataResponsibleRoleRoleIdTy.description: A [human-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#human-oriented) identifier reference to a `role` performed.

FlagOscalMetadataTelephoneNumberTypeType.title: type flag
FlagOscalMetadataTelephoneNumberTypeType.description: Indicates the type of phone number.

FlagOscalPoamPlanOfActionAndMilestonesUu.title: POA&M Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalPoamPlanOfActionAndMilestonesUu.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#instance)scope that can be used to reference this POA\&M instance in [this OSCAL instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#poam-identifiers). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

FlagOscalPoamPoamItemAssociatedRiskRiskU.title: Risk Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalPoamPoamItemAssociatedRiskRiskU.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a risk defined in the list of risks.

FlagOscalPoamPoamItemRelatedFindingFindi.title: Finding Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalPoamPoamItemRelatedFindingFindi.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a finding defined in the list of findings.

FlagOscalPoamPoamItemRelatedObservationO.title: Observation Universally Unique Identifier Reference
FlagOscalPoamPoamItemRelatedObservationO.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to an observation defined in the list of observations.

FlagOscalPoamPoamItemUuidType.title: POA&M Item Universally Unique Identifier
FlagOscalPoamPoamItemUuidType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#instance) scope that can be used to reference this POA\&M item entry in [this OSCAL instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#poam-identifiers). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

Base64Datatype.description: Binary data encoded using the Base 64 encoding algorithm as defined by RFC4648.

DateTimeWithTimezoneDatatype.description: A string representing a point in time with a required timezone.

EmailAddressDatatype.description: An email address string formatted according to RFC 6531.

MarkupLineDatatype.description: A single line of Markdown content conformant to the Commonmark specification.

MarkupMultilineDatatype.description: A multiple lines of Markdown content conformant to the Commonmark specification.

NonNegativeIntegerDatatype.description: An integer value that is equal to or greater than 0.

PositiveIntegerDatatype.description: An integer value that is greater than 0.

StringDatatype.description:
A non-empty string with leading and trailing whitespace disallowed. Whitespace is: U+9, U+10, U+32 or [ 
	]+

TokenDatatype.description: A non-colonized name as defined by XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition. https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-2/#NCName.

URIDatatype.description: A universal resource identifier (URI) formatted according to RFC3986.

URIReferenceDatatype.description: A URI Reference, either a URI or a relative-reference, formatted according to section 4.1 of RFC3986.

UUIDDatatype.description: A type 4 ('random' or 'pseudorandom') or type 5 UUID per RFC 4122.
